page.title: 13PIERS AND GARDENS
page.content: From the West Pier travelling east we come to the East Pier. Both piers have been extended and enlarged this century. Increased dredging has also taken place to remove a large bank of sand from between the two piers. At the foot of the East Pier a large car park was reclaimed from the loch at Port Rodie.The Information Centre was built here in 1977 for the ferry passengers and the growing number of tourists. Oposite this is The North West Castle Hotel. At one time the high tide would almost lap its walls, and indeed the gates of its boathouse can still be seen in the perimeter wall. Next to this is the Garden of Friendship or Rock Gardens.A piece of land gifted to the town by Lord Stair in 1931.They got their name because people could donate plants and shrubs to help the town council beautify it.
